sen.j: 蘇我 連子（そがのむらじこ、男性、推古天皇19年（611年）?-天智天皇3年（664年））は飛鳥時代の日本の豪族。
sen.e: SOGA no Murajiko (611? – 664) was a male member of a local ruling family in the Asuka Period.

sen.j: 「連子」であるが男性である（当時は「子」が男女問わずに用いられた）。
sen.e: Murajiko was a male noble. (While today Japanese given names ending in the syllable "ko" are mostly for females, at this time the syllable "ko" was often attached to the end of both male and female given names.)

sen.e: His father was SOGA no Kuramaro, also known as SOGA no Omasa ("Kugyobunin").

sen.e: His name was shortened as "Muraji" in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Fuso Ryakki" (A Brief History of Japan) but spelled differently in Chinese characters.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』「天智天皇紀」3年5月条に死亡記事が見られるのが同時代史料に見える連子の最初で最後の記述である。
sen.e: The obituary section in the article of May of the third year of "Chronicles of the Emperor Tenchi" of "Nihonshoki" was the only contemporary historical material relating to SOGA no Murajiko.

sen.j: このときの官位は「大紫」で「蘇我連大臣薨」と書かれていることから斉明天皇や天智天皇の下で大臣を務めていたことがわかる。
sen.e: We assume that he was a minister during the reign of the Empress Saimei and the Emperor Tenchi on the ground that his official court rank at this time was recorded as Daishi and the obituary wrote: "the minister SOGA no Murajiko died"
